H0.text: Transpiration is the process that takes place when plants release water vapor through pores in their leaves called stomata.

H1.text: Evaporation is the process that takes place when plants release water vapor through pores in their leaves called stomata.

H2.text: Expiration is the process that occurs when plants release water vapor through pores in their leaves called stomata.

H3.text: Propagation is the process that takes place when plants release water vapor through pores in their leaves called stomata.

A4.text: Water vapour diffuses through the stomata into the atmosphere as part of a process called transpiration.
